alert.note: Alert for Allamakee; Clayton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 13 at 3:05AM CST until January 14 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Winter Storm Exiting Followed by Bitter Cold... .The strong winter storm will continue to pull away today, but lingering light snow may produce up to an inch or two of additional snowfall for some areas. In addition, gusty winds will lead to some blowing and drifting, particularly across open areas of southeast Minnesota and northeast Iowa. Be prepared for slick, hazardous travel conditions today before conditions improve. Many untreated roads remain slick or snow-covered. Bitterly cold air will impact the region tonight into the coming week with wind chill values 20 to 35 below zero. Limit time outdoors, if possible. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Iowa, southeast Minnesota and central, north central, southwest and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CST today. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to noon CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. In Iowa, visit 511ia.org for road conditions. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
